name: subliminally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not recognized or understood by the conscious mind, but still has an influence on it: We are made subliminally aware of a bigger world outside, by the hum of traffic and a glow of light. I know that TV advertising is supposed to work subliminally.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's using our ancient fears, but it's done incredibly subtly and subliminally.The military aspect of the crusade is subliminally suggested by the figure holding a weapon.Medical schools condition students, albeit subliminally, to believe that the only ambition worth having is to become a consultant in a large hospital.
